trans-unit.source: Privileges on views, triggers, and constraints

target.mrk: Privileges on views, triggers, and constraints

trans-unit.source: Views, triggers, and constraints operate with the privileges of the owner of the view, trigger, or constraint.

seg-source.mrk: Views, triggers, and constraints operate with the privileges of the owner of the view, trigger, or constraint.

target.mrk: Views, triggers, and constraints operate with the privileges of the owner of the view, trigger, or constraint.

seg-source.mrk: SQL standard authorization mode

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose that user <codeph>anita</codeph> wants to create a view using the following statement:

seg-source.mrk: For example, suppose that user <codeph>anita</codeph> wants to create a view using the following statement:

target.mrk: For example, suppose that user <codeph>anita</codeph> wants to create a view using the following statement:

trans-unit.source: CREATE VIEW s.v(vc1,vc2,vc3) AS SELECT t1.c1,t1.c2,f(t1.c3) FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.c1 = t2.c1 WHERE t2.c2 = 5

seg-source.mrk: CREATE VIEW s.v(vc1,vc2,vc3) AS SELECT t1.c1,t1.c2,f(t1.c3) FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.c1 = t2.c1 WHERE t2.c2 = 5

target.mrk: CREATE VIEW s.v(vc1,vc2,vc3) AS SELECT t1.c1,t1.c2,f(t1.c3) FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.c1 = t2.c1 WHERE t2.c2 = 5

trans-unit.source: User <codeph>anita</codeph> needs the following privileges to create the view:

seg-source.mrk: User <codeph>anita</codeph> needs the following privileges to create the view:

target.mrk: User <codeph>anita</codeph> needs the following privileges to create the view:

trans-unit.source: Ownership of the schema <codeph>s</codeph>, so that she can create something in the schema

seg-source.mrk: Ownership of the schema <codeph>s</codeph>, so that she can create something in the schema

target.mrk: Ownership of the schema <codeph>s</codeph>, so that she can create something in the schema

trans-unit.source: Ownership of the table <codeph>t1</codeph>, so that she can allow others to see columns in the table

seg-source.mrk: Ownership of the table <codeph>t1</codeph>, so that she can allow others to see columns in the table

target.mrk: Ownership of the table <codeph>t1</codeph>, so that she can allow others to see columns in the table

trans-unit.source: SELECT privilege on column <codeph>t2.c1</codeph> and column <codeph>t2.c2</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: SELECT privilege on column <codeph>t2.c1</codeph> and column <codeph>t2.c2</codeph>

target.mrk: SELECT privilege on column <codeph>t2.c1</codeph> and column <codeph>t2.c2</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: EXECUTE privilege on function <codeph>f</codeph>

target.mrk: EXECUTE privilege on function <codeph>f</codeph>

trans-unit.source: When the view is created, only user <codeph>anita</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on it. User <codeph>anita</codeph> can grant the SELECT privilege on any or all of the columns of view <codeph>s.v</codeph> to anyone, even to users that do not have the SELECT privilege on <codeph>t1</codeph> or <codeph>t2</codeph>, or the EXECUTE privilege on <codeph>f</codeph>. User <codeph>anita</codeph> then grants the SELECT privilege on view <codeph>s.v</codeph> to user <codeph>harry</codeph>. When user <codeph>harry</codeph> issues a SELECT statement on the view <codeph>s.v</codeph>, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> checks to determine if user <codeph>harry</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on view <codeph>s.v</codeph>. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not check to determine if user <codeph>harry</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on <codeph>t1</codeph> or <codeph>t2</codeph>, or the EXECUTE privilege on <codeph>f</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: When the view is created, only user <codeph>anita</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on it.

User <codeph>anita</codeph> can grant the SELECT privilege on any or all of the columns of view <codeph>s.v</codeph> to anyone, even to users that do not have the SELECT privilege on <codeph>t1</codeph> or <codeph>t2</codeph>, or the EXECUTE privilege on <codeph>f</codeph>.
User <codeph>anita</codeph> then grants the SELECT privilege on view <codeph>s.v</codeph> to user <codeph>harry</codeph>.

When user <codeph>harry</codeph> issues a SELECT statement on the view <codeph>s.v</codeph>, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> checks to determine if user <codeph>harry</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on view <codeph>s.v</codeph>.

<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not check to determine if user <codeph>harry</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on <codeph>t1</codeph> or <codeph>t2</codeph>, or the EXECUTE privilege on <codeph>f</codeph>.

target.mrk: When the view is created, only user <codeph>anita</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on it.

User <codeph>anita</codeph> can grant the SELECT privilege on any or all of the columns of view <codeph>s.v</codeph> to anyone, even to users that do not have the SELECT privilege on <codeph>t1</codeph> or <codeph>t2</codeph>, or the EXECUTE privilege on <codeph>f</codeph>.
User <codeph>anita</codeph> then grants the SELECT privilege on view <codeph>s.v</codeph> to user <codeph>harry</codeph>.

When user <codeph>harry</codeph> issues a SELECT statement on the view <codeph>s.v</codeph>, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> checks to determine if user <codeph>harry</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on view <codeph>s.v</codeph>.

<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not check to determine if user <codeph>harry</codeph> has the SELECT privilege on <codeph>t1</codeph> or <codeph>t2</codeph>, or the EXECUTE privilege on <codeph>f</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: Privileges on triggers and constraints work the same way as privileges on views. When a view, trigger, or constraint is created, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> checks that the owner has the required privileges. Other users do not need to have those privileges to perform actions on a view, trigger, or constraint.

seg-source.mrk: Privileges on triggers and constraints work the same way as privileges on views.
When a view, trigger, or constraint is created, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> checks that the owner has the required privileges.
Other users do not need to have those privileges to perform actions on a view, trigger, or constraint.

target.mrk: Privileges on triggers and constraints work the same way as privileges on views.
When a view, trigger, or constraint is created, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> checks that the owner has the required privileges.
Other users do not need to have those privileges to perform actions on a view, trigger, or constraint.

trans-unit.source: If the required privileges are revoked from the owner of a view, trigger, or constraint, the object is dropped as part of the REVOKE statement.

seg-source.mrk: If the required privileges are revoked from the owner of a view, trigger, or constraint, the object is dropped as part of the REVOKE statement.

target.mrk: If the required privileges are revoked from the owner of a view, trigger, or constraint, the object is dropped as part of the REVOKE statement.

trans-unit.source: Another way of saying that privileges on objects belong to the owner is to call them <term>definer rights</term>, as opposed to <term>invoker rights</term>. This is the terminology used by the SQL standard.

seg-source.mrk: Another way of saying that privileges on objects belong to the owner is to call them <term>definer rights</term>, as opposed to <term>invoker rights</term>.
This is the terminology used by the SQL standard.

target.mrk: Another way of saying that privileges on objects belong to the owner is to call them <term>definer rights</term>, as opposed to <term>invoker rights</term>.
This is the terminology used by the SQL standard.
